patch.summary: UpdateAccount Updates a passed in account's display_name and metadata

post.summary: CreateMetadataEntry Creates a metadata entry for an account

put.summary: UpdateMetadataEntry Updates a passed in account's metadata for a specific entry

delete.summary: DeleteMetadataEntry Deletes a metadata entry for an account

parameters.name: entryKey
parameters.description: The key in the metadata whose entry needs to be deleted

get.summary: GetMetadataEntry Gets a metadata entry for a passed in key
GetMetadataEntries Gets all metadata entries for a passed in account id
GetServiceHealth Gets the health of the Accounts service, logging any errors

post.summary: LoginWithProvider Logs in a user with the given provider.

get.summary:
AwaitSession will send a message if the user successfully logs in or fails to log in after a timeout.
In this flow you will log in & go through the oauth flow, then wait for the callback to be called.
GetServiceHealth Gets the health of the Authentication service, logging any errors

post.summary: AllocateServerRequest asks the capacity service for the connection details to the next free server
DeAllocateServerRequest asks the capacity service to free up the server for other use
AdminCreateEntitlement Creates a new entitlement in our system with the specified information.

put.summary: AdminUpdtateEntitlement Updates the name, description, and/or the entitlement granting purchases of an existing entitlement.

get.summary: AdminGetAllEntitlements Fetches all existing entitlements in our system.

delete.summary: AdminDeleteEntitlement Deletes the specified entitlement from our system and revokes it from all users to whom it has previously been granted.

get.summary:
AdminGetEntitlementsByApproxName Fetches all entitlements whose name contains the specified keyword or a single entitlement if an exact name is provided. 
This should only be called when an admin clicks a search button so we are not 
making a request with each character typed into a search bar.

post.summary:
Allows an account to purchase a product from a supported IAP store.
This purchase can either be a one-time purchase that the account is billed for once
or a subscription purchase that the account is billed for on a recurring basis.

parameters.name: ticketId
parameters.description: The ID of the ticket for which we are polling matchmaking status.

post.summary: CreateParty Creates a new party setting the player who requested its creation as its leader.

patch.summary: Note: Append operations are not currently supported when updating metadata with this method

post.summary: JoinPartyWithInviteCode Allows a player to join a party by specifying its invite code.

get.summary: GetPartyInfo Fetches party information for the party that the requesting player is currently a member of.
GetPartyInfoByPartyId Fetches information for a party given a party ID.
GetPlayerInfoById Fetches information for a player in a party given an ID.

put.summary: SetPartyLeader Allows the current leader of a party to set a new leader.
KickFromParty Allows the leader of a party to kick another player from their party.
LeaveParty Allows a player to leave their party and assigns a new leader if the leader leaves.

post.summary: CreateMetadataEntry Creates a metadata entry for a party

put.summary: UpdateMetadataEntry Updates a passed in party's metadata for a specific entry

delete.summary: DeleteMetadataEntry Deletes a metadata entry for a party

parameters.name: innerRequest.entryKey
parameters.description: The key in the metadata whose entry needs to be deleted

get.summary: GetMetadataEntry Gets a metadata entry for a passed in key
GetMetadataEntries Gets all metadata entries for a passed in party id

authRole.description: The auth level of the account

providers.description: List of providers that this account is linked to

Account.description: Bundled data that describes an account and its metadata.

requestId.description: a generic string to associate allocation requests with eachother

profileId.description: the id of the profile to launch

matchId.description: The ID of the match to be assigned to this server

ticketId.description: The ID of the ticket for which we are cancelling matchmaking.

entryKey.description: The key in the metadata to be added

playerId.description: Optional: If included, query for a specific party member

DeleteJsonMetadataType.description:
If you are deleting a json, can choose whether to delete the entire entry or a partial part of an entry
Currently, only whole property removal is supported.
Removal of elements in a json array (e.g. trying to remove "value" from json {"array":["value","value2"]})
is not currently supported by DeleteMetadataEntryRequest.

entryDeleted.description: If the entry was found in the database and deleted

EmptyEvent.description: EmptyEvent is used to send pings through the event service, eg to get around bugs where a stream is not opened until the first request comes through, or to do a heartbeat

entitlementGrantingPurchases.description: references to IAP store purchases that grant this entitlement

Entity.description: We rely on the entity type for storing data about a user in the session token, this is crutial to enable

inviteCode.description: code used to join the party

playerId.description: ID of player to kick from party

partyId.description: ID of party to kick player from

sessionId.description: The session id to link into the currently logged in session id

accountLinked.description: indicator of success of linking existing account to new auth provider

payload.description: provider-specific auth token (username for unsafe provider)

redirectUri.description: redirect URI to send the user to if we are dealing with an oauth provider

MetadataEntry.description: Simple message containing a metadata key-value pair so that a metadata entry can be sent in update events

MetadataMap.description: Simple message containing a metadata map so that metadata entries can be sent in update events (maps are by default not supported in oneof)

partyId.description: The party id this event is associated with

playerId.description: ID of player to set as party leader

partyId.description: ID of party to set leader of

ticketId.description: The ID of the newly created matchmaking ticket.

priceId.description: Stripe-generated unique ID of the pricing plan for the product being purchased

entryKey.description: The key in the metadata whose entry needs to be changed

UpdateMetadataOperationType.description: When updating a metadata entry, the entry can either be overwritten (supported by all types) or appeneded (supported by string and json)

playerId.description: Optional: If included, query for a specific party member

tags.name: CatenaServerCapacity
tags.description:
*
The CatenaServerCapacity is responsible for allocating a server using the defined allocation plugin. It also provides a place to add some
algorithmic capacity management down the line.
